RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BILLY THE GREEK bobbled at the break and recovered outwards bumping COWBOY CODE and forcing that foe to take brief hold, chased just off the inside just off the pace, tucked inside through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch, dug in under a drive rallying into contention a furlong out, dug in taking narrow command inside the final seventy yards, got placed in tight as SAME OLD FEARS came inwards bumping ANCHISES into him and was directed slightly off the rail after the bump sending a small bump back outwards while just prevailing on the wire. FOXHOLE four wide in closest aim of the leader, tucked three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive heads apart for command the outermost of a quartet inside the final furlong, got brushed by SAME OLD FEARS near the sixteenth marker as that rival came out, came inwards slightly after that rival corrected and drifted in getting slightly pinched out between foes, followed him inwards, then got clipped behind by that same rival when just missing at the finish. ANCHISES three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and had SAME OLD FEARS drift in front near the sixteenth marker and altered in to the two path moving into a seam between foes, rallied on into that lane and was bumped by SAME OLD FEARS as that foe came in after brushing FOXHOLE and in turn bumped BILLY THE GREEK nearing the finish, had that rival come slightly out and was bumped again, this time bumping SAME OLD FEARS in behind FOXHOLE while steadied in tight between rivals to the finish. SAME OLD FEARS established the front and showed the way three then two wide coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, took the inside route into upper stretch, dug in under threat, came out and brushed with FOXHOLE near the sixteenth marker when headed for command, got corrected and came inwards seventy yards from home bumping ANCHISES into BILLY THE GREEK who rode through the tightness and bumping coming back out slightly to send a chain of bumps back outwards forcing ANCHISES to steady and pushing SAME OLD FEARS back out now in behind FOXHOLE, clipped heels with that rival and fell heavily directly over the finish line, the rider coming out of the saddle only after the finish, then was subsequently vanned off. COWBOY CODE got bumped at the start by BILLY THE GREEK and then got forced to steady behind that rival when he took over his lane and conceded four to five lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased along the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn, took the inside route into upper stretch, offered up a mild bid while never threatening. EVERY FOUR YEARS stumbled at the start, chased four wide coming under coaxing just past the three-eighths, swung four to five wide into upper stretch and tired. There was a Stewards' Inquiry into deep stretch focusing on the incident at the finish. After review the result was allowed to stand before the race was declared official.

ENTRY.NAME: Billy the Greek
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled st, just off pace 2p, ins turn, ins 1/4, in tight bump,up

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Kenneth L. Ramsey & Sarah K. Ramsey

ENTRY.NAME: Cowboy Code
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, steadied st, chased ins, 2p turn, ins 1/4, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Every Four Years
ENTRY.OWNER: Caruso Michael J and Dubb Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased 4w, 4-5w turn, 4-5w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Same Old Fears
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace 3-2w, ins 1/4, drift out headed 1/16, clip heels, fell wire

ENTRY.NAME: Anchises
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, bumped 2x late, steady wire

ENTRY.NAME: Foxhole
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w in aim, coax 3w 5/16, 4w uppr, dug in, came in, clip beh, miss

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 95. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 162500. (PURSE $125,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $28,275 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 THREE TIMES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVEN OT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $80,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $80,000 (Allowance Hor ses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HEADLAND brushed with a rival at the start then brushed again with that same foe early, pressed the pace on the outside, turned up the pressure in the three path on the turn, gained a short lead before the five-sixteenths, responded well when asked at the top of the stretch, kicked clear inside the three-sixteenths and drew away under steady urging. TOP GUN GIRL broke out and bobbled then brushed with a rival, brushed again with that opponent early, showed the way under pressure from both sides, vied in the two path while inside of the winner on the turn, was headed near the five-sixteenths, lost touch with the winner inside the three-sixteenths and proved no match while clear for the place. ROSEBUG moved out early while at the rear, drifted out near the nine-sixteenths, angled in late on the backstretch, raced in the two path early on the turn then was roused in the three path later on the bend, was driven four wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response while best of the rest. EDIE MEENY MINY MO was hustled from the gate, pressed the pace on the inside of two foes, dropped back late on the backstretch, chased inside on the turn and tired. BRAGANZA was off a bit slow then angled out early, raced at the rear under urging then caught up with ROSEBUG near the five-eighths, was carried out near the nine-sixteenths, moved in late on the backstretch, chased four wide on the turn, spun six wide into the stretch then quickly drifted well out and in the track and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Braganza
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit slw brk,mvd out,urged,carried out4-1/2,4w,6w1/4,drift,falter

ENTRY.NAME: Rosebug
ENTRY.COMMENT: moved out,drifted out 4-1/2,mvd in1/2,2-3p turn,4w1/4,best rest

ENTRY.NAME: Edie Meeny Miny Mo
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,pressed inside duo,drop back 1/2,inside turn,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Top Gun Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,bobbled,brshd,set pace,2p turn,headed5/16,no match

ENTRY.NAME: Headland
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd brk,brshd early,press outside,3p turn,lead5/16,kicked clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 91. Claiming Purse 46000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR THREE YEAR OLDS. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ORDER OF MAGNITUDE coaxed from the gate, raced three then two wide through the opening bend in close aim of the early leader briefly before taking over, showed the way in hand along the inside down the backstretch, briefly tipped to the two path near the half mile pole before tucking back inside through the far turn, got given a notch to work with inside the five-sixteenths and began to shake away, swung just off the inside into upper stretch set down for the drive, drew off under a drive to prevail. EMPIRE RIDE hustled from the start, chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the far turn coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while running on clear of the rest to be along second best. CUMBERLAND BLUES two to three wide through the first turn, chased five paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking inside through the far turn, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and weakened. LIFE AND LIGHT chased four then three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung three wide into upper stretch, tired. BODOCK chased three then two wide under coaxing from the half mile pole, angled four wide into upper stretch, drifted out straightened away and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Life and Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4-3w, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Cumberland Blues
ENTRY.OWNER: Final Turn Racing Stable LLC and Celeritas Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w 1st turn, 5w backstretch, coaxed ins 7/16, ins 1/4, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Empire Ride
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, chased 2p, coax ins 7/16, 3w uppr, no match, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Order of Magnitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 3-2w 1st turn, in hand ins, 2w 1/4p, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Bodock
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 1/2p, angled 4w upper, drifted, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Curlin S. SARATOGA RACE 4 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 101. Stakes Purse 135000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NOT WON A GRADED SWEEPSTAKES AT A MILE OR OVER IN 2023. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $135 each which should accompany the nomination; $675 t o pass the entry box and an additional $675 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $675 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to t he winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 124 lbs. Non-winners of a sweepstake in 2023 allowed 2 lbs.; of a Graded sweepstake lifetime or two races other than maiden, c laiming, starter or State-bred allowance at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 4 lbs.; of a race other than maiden, claiming, starter or State-bred allowance at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. Closed Sat
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SCOTLAND moved in while showing early speed, raced inside on the first turn, was well rated while setting the pace on the inside of a foe, vied in the two path on the far turn, responded well when asked outside the quarter-pole, shook clear in upper stretch, came under a right-handed crop near the furlong marker, remained under the crop until just before the sixteenth-pole then was placed under a hand-ride and was eased up late while much the best. IL MIRACOLO was hustled from the gate then established a forward position, had the rider drop anchor into the first turn, raced in the three path under stout restraint on that bend, prompted the pace on the outside, drew even inside the three-quarter pole, was let out in the three path on the far turn, lost touch with the winner under a drive in upper stretch and proved no match while clear for the place. BLAZING SEVENS bumped with a rival at the start then jostled with that same foe, went three wide for most of the first turn then shifted to the four path, was rated just off the pace on the outside, came under urging in the four path on the far turn, was put to the crop outside the quarter-pole, pursued the top two into upper stretch and weakened while clear for the show. LOST ARK broke out and bumped with an opponent then jostled with that same rival early, went around the first turn in the two path, was rated just off the pace between foes, dropped back under urging leaving the backstretch, moved from the two path to the four path under strong encouragement on the far turn, came five wide into the stretch under the crop and failed to respond. PERFORM was rated inside on the first turn, became rank late on that bend and was taken under a tighter hold then was taken up, raced just off the pace, dropped back under urging leaving the backstretch, saved ground on the far turn and had nothing left.

ENTRY.NAME: Perform
ENTRY.OWNER: Woodford Racing LLC Lane's End Racing Phipps Stable Langone Ken and Hudson Jr Ed
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated ins1st,rank3/4,tkn up,just off pace,drop back7/16,ins,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Lost Ark
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,bmpd,jstld,2p1st,btwn,drop back7/16,2-4p2nd,5p1/4,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Blazing Sevens
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,jostled,3-4w1st,outside,ask4p2nd,chased,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Scotland
ENTRY.COMMENT: mvd in,ins1st,well rated ins foe,2p2nd,ask1/4,clear,eased up late

ENTRY.NAME: Il Miracolo
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,anchored1m,3p1st,outside,let out 3p2nd,no match

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 5 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Maiden Claiming Purse 50000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be V oid). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIE BREAKER coaxed from the gate, chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung five wide into upper stretch, took over command at the three-sixteenths and drew clear under a drive to prevail. VAUNTED grew a bit fractious in the gate prior to the start inspiring a brief and small rebellion from ALPHA SONNY and SIN NOMBRE soon after, broke out at the start bumping ALPHA SONNY into SIN NOMBRE, chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled six wide into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while running on to be along clear for the place honors. UNDER THE KNIFE broke in at the start bumping and forcing SIN NOMBRE to steady and alter briefly, chased four then three wide in aim of the leader, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. SINALOA chased two to three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch, passed tired rivals. WOODSIDE WARRIOR hustled from the gate, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, cut the corner into upper stretch, tipped out straightened away and weakened. THE GOLDEN ONE stumbled at the start conceding three to four lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased four then three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, went seven wide into upper stretch and weakened. IMPULSIVE SPENDING chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch, weakened in the drive. STEERAGE hustled from the gate, showed the way in hand just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn and was placed to coaxing near the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch under threat, yielded near the three-sixteenths and weakened to the finish. ALPHA SONNY grew fractious in the gate just after VAUNTED did and then inspired SIN NOMBRE to do so, got bumped at the start by VAUNTED and in turn bumped SIN NOMBRE, chased six to seven paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked five wide through the turn, went seven wide into upper stretch and weakened. SIN NOMBRE grew fractious when inspired by ALPHA SONNY to do so as that rival got fractious just prior, got bumped and steadied at the start and altered outwards conceding four lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased eight to nine paths off the inside down the backstretch and then five wide through the turn, went nine wide into upper stretch and offered no kick. IT'S NOT MY FAULT three then two wide in closest aim of the leader, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun two to three wide for home, faded and faltered in the drive and was eased through the final furlong to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Woodside Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, cut corner, tip out, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: The Golden One
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 3/8, 7w upper, weakened

ENTRY.OWNER: Arenas Marcelo and God's Glory Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4-3w, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Sinaloa
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, angled 5-6w upper, passed tired foes

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Steerage
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, in hand 2p, ins turn, inside 1/4, yielded 3/16, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: It's Not My Fault
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w in aim, coaxed 3/8, 2-3w upper, faded, faltered, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Vaunted
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 5/16, 6w upper, no match, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Alpha Sonny
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, 6-7w backstretch, 5w turn, 7w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Sin Nombre
ENTRY.OWNER: Zilla Racing Stables Black Jack Racing LLC and Acqua Nova Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, steadied st, 8-9w early, 5w turn, 9w upper, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Under the Knife
ENTRY.OWNER: Englehart Jeffrey S Photos Finish LLC and Bowman Peter C
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, coaxed, chased 4-3w, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Tie Breaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 5-4w, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, up 3/16, drew clr

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 6 1 1/4M Dirt CR: 97. Allowance Purse 149500. INNER TURF (PURSE $115,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COSTA TERRA moved in entering the first turn, went three wide on that bend, was reserved in the back half of the field, came under urging while three then four wide on the far turn, gained under a drive into upper stretch, made a bid under a left-handed crop at the three-sixteenths, swapped back to his inside lead at the furlong marker, gained the advantage outside the sixteenth-pole, switched back to the proper lead inside that pole and moved clear under good handling. ROYAL SPIRIT was hustled from the gate, stalked the pace on the outside while in hand, took the lead midway through the far turn, shook clear while asked coming to the quarter-pole, came under a right-handed crop in upper stretch, led desperately into the final furlong then was overtaken while well clear for the place. O CAPTAIN brushed with a rival after the start, went three wide on the first turn, settled just off the pace, chased three wide on the far turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and weakened while best of the rest. C FALLS went to the front, showed the way on the inside, was asked on the far turn, lost the lead at the three-eighths and tired then was vanned off after the race. CATCH THAT PARTY was off slow and spotted the front a few lengths, rounded the first turn in the two path, dropped back some early on the backstretch, was reserved while last but one, moved from the two path to the four path on the final turn and failed to threaten. GOOD MEDICINE brushed with a foe after the start, was rated on the inside, saved ground under urging on the far turn and came up empty. HILLIARD went two to three wide on the turns while at the rear and was no factor. BABY BILLY was hustled from the gate, went four wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, dropped back late on the backstretch, came up empty while going from the four path to the seven path on the far turn and faltered then was eased but walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Billy
ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Thoroughbred Racing Rocco Steven and Branch William
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,4p1st,outside,through after 3/4,faltered,eased,wlkd off

ENTRY.NAME: C Falls
ENTRY.OWNER: Ten Strike Racing LLC and AJ Suited Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: to front,inside pace,ask2nd turn,headed3/8,tired,vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,2p1st,stlkd outside,lead 2p3/8,clr1/4,overtaken,clear2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Good Medicine
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed after brk,rated inside,asked 2nd turn,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: O Captain
ENTRY.OWNER: Iavarone Michael Iavarone Julia C OGMA Investments LLC Restrepo Ramiro and Towel
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd after brk,3w1st,just off pace,chased 3w2nd trn,wknd,held3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Catch That Party
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow,2p1st,reserved,2-4p2nd turn,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Hilliard
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w1st,at rear,2path 2nd turn,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Costa Terra
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w1st,reserved,ask3-4w2nd,bid 3/16,lead ins 1/8,edged clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 88. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ABADIN established the front and showed the way in hand along the inside settled into a comfortable rhythm under some pressure from SILO RIDGE to the outside, remained patiently handled until set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, edged away under a drive to the eighth pole, held well to the finish. TREATY OBLIGATION three wide in pursuit from mid pack, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four to five wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick to secure the place honors. COALVILLE chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch, offered up a bid a furlong out, then flattened out in the late stages while safe for the show honors. LUCENCY struck the near side stall at the start conceding two to three lengths to the front, chased just off the inside under a ride from the three-eighths, angled three to four wide at the quarter pole, then angled out to be eight to nine wide straightened away and kicked on belatedly to the finish. SILO RIDGE prompted the pace of ABADIN from the outside three then two wide, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened. BIG NIGHT OUT broke in at the start, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch, weakened. CREATE TROUBLE four then three wide in pursuit, got coaxed along at the three-eighths, swung three wide into upper stretch, weakened in the drive. BREES veered in at the start and conceded five to six lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased along the inside climbing greenly and facing kickback while growing detached at the tail of the field, tipped briefly to the two path through the turn before taking the inside route into upper stretch and made no impact. GAME KEEPER got steadied when pinched out between foes six and a half furlongs from home, chased six then five wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung six wide into upper stretch and made no impact. MOTIVO stumbled at the start conceding four lengths before settling into stride, chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, swung four to five wide for home and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Brees
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered in st, climbed green, chased ins, inside 1/4, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Big Night Out
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, chased ins, coaxed 7/16, inside 1/4, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Motivo
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 7/16, 4-5w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Lucency
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate st, chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, tip 8-9w, belated

ENTRY.NAME: Abadin
ENTRY.OWNER: Three Diamonds Farm and Main Line Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand ins, set down 2w 1/4p, edged away, held well

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: James & Janeane Everatt, J. ArikaEveratt-Meeuse & Speights

ENTRY.NAME: Treaty Obligation
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 4-5w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Game Keeper
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied, pinched after st, chased 6-5w, 6w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Coalville
ENTRY.OWNER: Lawrence William H Drown Jeffrey Rachel Don Don Alberto Stable and Bridlewood Fa
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, bid, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Silo Ridge
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Create Trouble
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 8 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 107. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 156000. (PURSE $120,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $27,144 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Du e At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BRIGHT FUTURE went around the first turn in the two path, stalked the pace on the outside, was asked in the two to three path on the far turn then chased the leader, gained under a drive to make a bid in the four path into upper stretch, shook clear into the final furlong, extended the advantage under a right-handed crop into the final sixteenth then was hand-ridden to the finish while much the best. SPEED BIAS bumped lightly with a foe at the start then was coaxed to the front, raced inside on the first turn, showed the way with company to his outside, vied inside to the two path on the far turn, was asked near the quarter-pole, lost the lead under a drive in upper stretch and proved no match for the winner. ARTORIUS brushed the outside of the gate at the start, came inward early, went three wide on the first turn, settled just off the pace on the outside, ranged up three to four wide on the far turn, made a bid while roused five wide into the stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and tired then missed the place while clear for the show. THE REDS made light contact with an opponent at the start, bumped with another rival early, dropped to the rail into the first turn, was well placed on the inside, came under urging while continuing to save ground on the far turn and capitulated. CURBSTONE was off slow and spotted the front a few lengths, settled on the inside, was asked late on the backstretch, saved ground on the far turn, swung four wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. CONSTITUTIONLAWYER brushed the outside of the gate and was off slow, spotted the front a few lengths, settled off the pace, was roused near the seven-sixteenths, went two then three wide on the far turn, was driven five wide into the stretch and failed to respond. MAJOR BLUE was caught five wide early on the first turn then dropped to the three path while taking an opponents path, settled towards the rear, was roused with a half-mile to run, went three wide on the far turn and also failed to respond. KUCHAR was sent hard from the start, bumped with a rival early then was taken up while put in tight between horses, checked in the three path when shut-off early on the first turn, was reserved at the back, was urged four then five wide on the far turn and was no factor. MONTAUK POINT went four wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, was urged four wide on the far turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Curbstone
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow,settled inside,ask1/2,4w into lane,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Speed Bias
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnston Keith F and Sparks William S
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump brk,coaxd to front,pace ins foe,ins-2p,headed3/16,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: The Reds
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump brk,bmp early,well placed ins,ask2nd turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Kuchar
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent,bmpd early,tkn up,checked 3w1st,settled,4-5w2nd,no response

ENTRY.NAME: Constitutionlawyer

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Lake George S. - Grade3 SARATOGA RACE 9 1M Inner turf CR: 97. Stakes Purse 175000. INNER TURF FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $175 each which should accompany the nomination; $875 to pass the entry box and an additional $875 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $875 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fo urth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded sweepstake at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstake in 2023 or two races other than maiden, claiming, starter or State-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 4 lbs.; of a sweepstake or a race other than maiden, claiming, starter or State-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfe
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SURGE CAPACITY forwardly placed under rating along the inside into the first turn, got forced to steady at the seven-eighths when a rival tucked in front, tracked the front just off the inside from just off the pace, tucked to the rail at the five-sixteenths when the leader left a seam and remained in the two path, came under coaxing near the quarter pole, cut the corner into upper stretch, scraped the paint to the inside of SECRET MONEY to take command a furlong from home, then dug in inching away to the finish kept to task. TAX IMPLICATIONS (GB) just off the inside into the first turn, tracked the front two to three wide from just off the pace, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths and angled five wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive running on willingly to secure the place honors in the final jumps to the finish. SECRET MONEY established the front shortly after the start and showed the way crossing to the inside through the first turn before taking to the two path down the backstretch, settled into a comfortable rhythm under attendance from PRINCESS BETTINA to the outside but facing little pressure save her presence, remained in the two path through the far turn coming under coaxing under challenge for the initial time with five-sixteenths to go, swung three then two wide shaking off her escort straightened away confronted by a flanking pair of stable and barn mates, dug in and was collared a furlong from home, fought on between those rivals loosely to the finish, clear for the show honors. REVALITA (FR) three wide through the first turn, chased four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, went six wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild bid. LIGURIA chased three then two wide coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, angled six wide into upper stretch, offered no response. TRYINMYHEARTOUT got away to awkward stumble at the start, raced three then two wide through the first turn, chased three to four wide down the backstretch before tucking inside through the far turn, tipped three then two wide into upper stretch and weakened. PRINCESS BETTINA attended the leader from the outside three wide before coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths to issue a challenge for the initial time, swung four wide into upper stretch in the midst of being shaken off, then weakened in the stretch. LIL MISS MOONLIGHT three wide through the first turn, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing five-sixteenths from home, angled five wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Surge Capacity
ENTRY.COMMENT: steady 7/8, tracked 2p, cut corner, up 1/8p, inched away

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 10 1M Dirt CR: 81. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the S tewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BOURBON CHASE bumped hard multiple times with a rival at the start, dropped back while saving ground on the first turn, moved out on the backstretch, rallied four wide on the far turn, closed well to get the lead into upper stretch then drifted in under a left-handed crop, fought outside of the runner-up to the sixteenth-pole, came in a bit more shortly thereafter then moved clear late to prevail. MISSION HILL bumped hard multiple times with foes on both sides at the start, dropped from the two path to the rail on the first turn, was well placed just off the pace, drafted inside on the far turn, was asked at the quarter-pole, cut the corner through a rail opening into upper stretch, made a bid inside the three-sixteenths, fought inside of the winner into the final sixteenth, shied when that foe came in a touch shortly thereafter then was taken up while moving over heels late and missed but was well clear for the place. LT. MITCHELL went to the front, dropped from the six path to the two path on the first turn, showed the way down the backstretch, vied in the two path on the far turn, lost the advantage into upper stretch then dropped back and weakened but was clear for the show. UTAMARO dropped from the five path to the three path on the first turn, settled in the middle of the field, dropped back three wide on the far turn, spun four wide into the stretch and failed to rally. BORDER PATROL went two to three wide on the first turn, tracked the pace on the outside, was asked near the half-mile pole, chased in the three path on the far turn, dropped back late on that bend and tired. TONY O lost his footing at the start, traveled four wide on the first turn, settled at the rear, moved from three to five wide under urging on the far turn and was no factor. ALL GOOD HERE rounded the first turn in the four path, settled on the outside, moved closer midway down the backstretch, chased four then three wide on the turn, made a bid coming to the five-sixteenths, dropped back in upper stretch and capitulated. TIP OF THE BOOT bumped hard with a foe at the start, raced three wide on the first turn, settled towards the back, was roused near the nine-sixteenths, went around the far turn under urging while inside to the two path, moved out in upper stretch and failed to respond. FOLLOWING A RIDERS CLAIM OF FOUL AND A STEWARDS INQUIRY INTO THE STRETCH RUN, THERE WAS NO CHANGE MADE TO THE ORDER OF FINISH

ENTRY.NAME: Bourbon Chase
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd hard brk,ins1st,mvd out,rally4w2nd,lead3/16,came in,clr late
